reviews.title: I would not recommend and I will tell‚Ä¶
reviews.content: I would not recommend and I will tell you why.I bought 2 accounts with them on April 5th and they had a profit target of 2%, they changed the rules and raised the profit target for new accounts and that is fine, but they closed my accounts and gave me new ones with new rules haha WTF. It is not fair and is frivolous. I contacted customer service but they could not help me.
reviews.reply_content: Hi Dana, Thanks for sharing your feedback. We understand the confusion and want to clarify what happened. You purchased your accounts on April 5, before the rule update on April 27. On May 6, we emailed all eligible traders and posted publicly on Discord, giving a clear deadline of May 11 to choose one of two options: Request a full refund if you did not want to continue Keep trading under the updated structure, with a free reset if you were in drawdown, bonus access to ASFX TV, and a 10% stackable discount. Since both of your accounts were in more than 1 percent drawdown at the time, you received a free reset as promised. The accounts were not closed, and support acted in line with the policy shared well in advance. We always aim to be transparent and fair, especially when making changes that impact active traders. If anything still feels unresolved, feel free to reach out. We are happy to take another look for you. Top One Futures Team

reviews.reply_content: Hi Aanchal Jaisingh, We appreciate your previous participation and want to provide full transparency regarding your case. Your accounts were not breached without cause, nor were payouts withheld. In fact, your latest payouts were approved and paid as a sign of goodwill ‚Äî despite violations of our sim farming and account churning policies. Specifically: You purchased 20+ accounts within just 23 trading days (0.9 account per day) You requested payouts on 10 different accounts A repeated pattern was observed: receiving a payout, then breaching shortly after, with no intention of transitioning to live trading As outlined in our Terms and in this article: "Traders may not attempt to deliberately fail or breach funded accounts to avoid transitioning to live trading, remain on simulated accounts, or game system protections." https://intercom.help/top-one-futures/en/articles/11021584-prohibited-trading-practices This type of behavior ‚Äî known as sim farming ‚Äî violates our policies and compromises the integrity of our funding program. While we still chose to honor your payouts, the decision to terminate the agreement was based on this clear pattern. Additionally, an official email explaining the decision was sent to you on June 13th, just 2 minutes after the action was taken. We‚Äôve been fully transparent and followed up appropriately. We understand your frustration, but we stand by our decision. We wish you all the best in your future trading endeavors. ‚Äî The Top One Futures Team

I requested the full $3500, and was only paid $1,100, they deducted $1,995 as a penalty fee saying my trading was scalping, which all day traders scalp, seriously frustrating.  The $1,995 sim money goes back to house, crazy‚Ä¶Giving me Apex vibes for sure‚Ä¶hopefully they don‚Äôt continue down this route, way too many companies out there now not doing shady stuff.  I was really excited to trade with this firm and now I‚Äôm very turned off.  Going to think twice about buying more accounts if this is their normal.  Back to Take Profit Trader, where they don‚Äôt hide shady rules in fine print.

reviews.title: Appealing case
reviews.content: I wrote a review about a week ago and was advised to do an appeal for my case. I wrote the appeal request email on 06/27/25 and I haven‚Äôt gottten a response that my email was received. I have also chat with a representative from toponefutures website and they cant provide me with further information. How can I appeal a case if I don‚Äôt get a response? I need help. My case needs to be resolved.
reviews.reply_content: Hi Jackie, Thanks for your feedback. We take all such claims seriously and want to clarify the situation. Your account was flagged during a routine investigation into group trading violations, which are clearly outlined in our public rules. Specifically, we detected multiple instances of near-identical trade structures ‚Äî not just in entries, but in timing, sizing, and asset selection ‚Äî between your account and another trader's, executed within milliseconds of each other. While you mention that some positions were opposing, coordinated group trading doesn‚Äôt require all trades to mirror direction ‚Äî what matters is the synchronized execution patterns, which can indicate the use of shared signals, bots, or communication. This pattern occurred despite a span of time, which strengthens the concern rather than weakens it. Additionally, as per our Copy Trading / Group Trading rule: "Following trade signals or recommendations where multiple traders execute similar trades at similar times is banned. If multiple traders take the exact same trade within a set time, it will flag in our system and may lead to disqualification." More details here: https://intercom.help/top-one-futures/en/articles/11021584-prohibited-trading-practices Discord bans are issued when community guidelines are violated, including excessive tagging, threats, or spam during an ongoing review. We understand that denial of a payout is frustrating, but abusive behavior towards the team is never acceptable. That said, if you believe the decision was made in error, you‚Äôre welcome to submit a detailed appeal with all relevant context via email. We‚Äôll re-review your case fairly and transparently. ‚Äî Top One Futures Team

reviews.title: Stay away from this scam
reviews.content: A terrible and expensive experience. They delete trades under 10 seconds from the account, which is understandable. However, negative trades under 10 seconds are still taken into account. Even worse, they don't adjust the maximum drawdown after the positive trades have been deducted. After a profit of $7,500 and a requested withdrawal, the withdrawal was denied, and a profit of $3,000 was deducted. However, the drawdown was not adjusted. Support doesn't respond to emails and ignored the complaint.
reviews.reply_content: Hi Bas, Thanks for sharing your feedback ‚Äî we understand your frustration and would like to clear up a few things. The 10-second minimum trade duration rule is clearly outlined in our policies and applies to all our traders. If trades under 10 seconds result in profit and they make up a significant portion of your withdrawable amount (close to or over 50%), those profits are disqualified ‚Äî which is what happened in your case. However, losing trades under 10 seconds are not deducted from your balance, and they are not considered in the payout disqualification process. As for the max drawdown: it is always calculated live and in real-time, based on your peak balance and live equity. We do not retroactively adjust this when trades are removed due to violations ‚Äî and this is the standard approach across the industry to prevent manipulation. We're always open to a deeper review if you feel something wasn‚Äôt handled fairly. Please don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out again ‚Äî we‚Äôre happy to double-check everything for you. ‚Äî Top One Futures Team

reviews.title: ONE TIME IS ONE TIME TOO MANY
reviews.content: @TopOneFutures decided to delete my accounts after 2nd payout on Thursday June 26,2025. The reasoning was because I ‚Äúapparently‚Äù breach accounts post payout. Only ever had a total of 6 accounts with them taken to payout. Purchased 1 during launch. Took payout from that one. Purchased 2 more from the funds received. Totaling 3. Took all 3 to payout. 1 account was at payout 2. Remaining 2 were at payout 1. Tilted out and lost all 3 in a day. Purchased another set of 3. Took all 3 to payout 1 and payout 2. Traded a day on them leaving me 9 days into payout 3 also potential live. Had a balance of 161,984-991 on each. Got a email later that afternoon with this accusation. Mods replied back to the incident saying ‚Äúone time is one time too many.‚Äù All payout requests were APPROVED and PAID. But stopping me 9 days away was a mental toll and quite unfair. I‚Äôm sure everyone here has tilted into blowout atleast once if not many times. Shit happens but instead of working with traders to set boundaries the solution they resorted to was just deleting the accounts completely. Their compensation was a 50k Intraday account ü§£ Mind you @TakeProfitLLC has intraday that also comes with daily payout potential. This IS NOT a FUD starter this is an AWARENESS post. If you‚Äôre not a ‚Äúperfect‚Äù trader risk manager or whatever they want, you will have your accounts deleted from an incident that occurred ONCE. I was considering trading the 50k. But reading the rules of it nearly having 20 % consistency along with TIDD UNTIL FIRST PAYOUT. So no it doesn‚Äôt stop +100 after DD it‚Äôs continuous into first payout. Probably the weirdest prop skewed rules I ever seen. Anyone who considers them just make sure you‚Äôre freaking perfect cause if you‚Äôre not they‚Äôll randomly delete your shit with an even more outrageous blast from the past - skeleton from the closet reasoning .
reviews.reply_content: Hi Mitil, Thank you for sharing your feedback ‚Äî here‚Äôs some important clarification. Your accounts were offboarded due to a clear violation of our trading rules related to sim farming, which is outlined in our terms: 14. Intentional Account Breaching (Sim Farming) Traders may not attempt to deliberately fail or breach funded accounts to avoid transitioning to live trading, remain on simulated accounts, or game system protections. Despite this violation, we still approved and paid out your requested payouts to show good faith and transparency in our process. However, after identifying clear intended breaches following prior payouts ‚Äî including deliberate 'tilt behavior '‚Äî we made the decision to terminate your accounts to maintain the integrity of our program. We aim to support serious traders who are ready to transition to live capital and build consistency ‚Äî not to reward those actively avoiding it. This policy is in place to protect the structure and opportunity for all compliant traders in our ecosystem. As a courtesy, we even offered you a 50K Intraday account. We understand it‚Äôs not the same as your prior balances, but it reflects our willingness to still offer an opportunity, despite what occurred. Wishing you success in your future trading. ‚Äî Top One Futures Team

reviews.title: Reported to Action Fraud UK
reviews.content: **EDIT** After reading their misleading reply, they even admit to breaking their own compliance rules by paying me twice without verifying KYC - They will constantly move the goalpost. Even if they pay me what im owed and apologised, I still wouldn‚Äôt use their services. Reported to Action Fraud UK. Essentially blackmailed me for sensitive information(wedding photos and wedding certificate), which led me to suspect identity fraud. My wife purchased my first account, they put the account in her name by default. I informed them of this, and they said do KYC under my name and no problem. KYC approved, got first payout. No problem. Requested second payout, now they tell me about a name discrepancy, that I already informed them about. They asked for proof, my ID and wife ID, and selfie of me holding both before they can approve payout. Strange(wasn't a problem first time). I complied and gave them the documents. They then said this wasn't enough and asked for wedding photos and wedding certificate. Of course I refused, due to privacy and security issues(this is an unregulated organization we're talking about). I have asked for a refund and haven't had a reply since(2 weeks ago). On the off chance they ask everyone for wedding information, I will give acct # so they can identify me. #TOF-PX-44448
reviews.reply_content: Hi Christopher, Thanks for sharing your feedback. We want to be fully transparent about your case, as there are some important points that need to be addressed. Firstly, Top One Futures does not engage in identity fraud, and we do not request personal documentation without valid cause. Your situation raised several compliance red flags due to name discrepancies across your trading account, payout profile, and payment method. Initially, you stated that the account was gifted by your wife. However, based on the documentation provided, it appeared the individual may have actually been your mother, which naturally required clarification. To resolve this, we asked for a wedding certificate ‚Äî not to intrude, but to confirm the relationship, as this directly affects payout eligibility and compliance standards. Per our publicly stated policy (https://intercom.help/top-one-futures/en/articles/11021584-prohibited-trading-practices), only the registered account owner is permitted to trade. Friends, family, or third parties may not access or trade on the account under any circumstances. Despite this, we still gave you the benefit of the doubt and approved two payouts ‚Äî including the second one, which we processed even as we awaited additional verification documents on the same day. However, to move forward with any further payouts or account access, we now require appropriate documentation to close the loop and comply with international KYC and anti-fraud standards. We understand your concerns around privacy, and your data is always handled with the utmost security and confidentiality. But compliance is not optional ‚Äî it protects all traders and ensures the integrity of our platform. We're still open to resolving this fairly and professionally. Please feel free to reach out. ‚Äî Top One Futures Team

reviews.title: DLL platform issue when purchased plan without a DLL
reviews.content: DLL platform issue.There was an issue where I purchased the accounts without the DLL as an addon.I get stopped out for my stoploss, then make back the difference to hit my consistency as i am one day from payout. and i find that the trade i made back the difference on is only taken on one account but i have always group traded with you guys. it seems some of them got locked by that limit i did not have.. and they refused to be responsible for the project x issue. me losing out on $7000 because of this. but they still paid me on time... 0/5 customer support skills. I was even a founder to your firm and you treat me an OG like this...
reviews.reply_content: Thanks for sharing your experience. We understand the frustration regarding the DLL situation, especially so close to a payout. This was a temporary issue on Project X that affected accounts without the DLL add-on, and we want to confirm it has since been fully resolved. To clarify, when an account is purchased without the DLL, the equity lock is disabled by default, this is shown clearly during the checkout process. Because some of your accounts were missing the add-on, they weren‚Äôt protected by the equity shield, which led to them stopping out under standard parameters. That said, your payout was still processed on time, which reflects our commitment to honoring payouts when rules are followed, even in situations where platform-side issues play a role. We appreciate traders who‚Äôve been with us since the beginning, and we‚Äôre always open to suggestions on how we can improve.

reviews.reply_content: Hi Youness, Thanks for your feedback ‚Äî I understand the frustration. To clarify, once an account breaches the Max Drawdown rule, the trading platform access is automatically disabled. This is necessary because maintaining access to breached accounts incurs ongoing platform and data fees, which are charged monthly per account. That said, you can still review all your past trades and performance data directly from your account dashboard, including your trading journal notes and metrics. We absolutely support trader growth and learning ‚Äî that‚Äôs why the data remains available to you even after a breach. We appreciate your understanding and hope this helps clarify the situation. ‚Äî Top One Futures Team

reviews.title: Top one futures is a Trash company
reviews.content: Top one futures is a trash company. It started on April 2, 2025. Its beginning was good: the payout took less than 4 hours, now at least takes over 48 hours, more and more people got denied payout. Then It is changing rules every week and getting harder and harder for traders to get to payout. I was not only denied payout, but also permanently banned from their platform, claiming group trading using the same IPs without giving me a chance to appeal. They kept 20k of my profit  If it has 0 Stars, I will choose it. SPEND YOUR MONEY SOMEWHERE ELSE. Do your research!It was my hard work to get those 6 payouts. You kept over 20k of my profit, breached my accounts, and removed me from your Discord. You are thieves and running a Ponzi scam. Thanks to Trustpilot for letting other traders hear my voice. PLEASE RUN AWAY FROM THEM BEFORE THEY PULL THE RUGS LIKE FTT.
reviews.reply_content: Dear Rebecca, We take all allegations of rule violations seriously and conduct thorough investigations to ensure fairness and integrity across our platform. Our decision to mark your accounts as breached was based on clear, irrefutable evidence of group trading, which is a direct violation of our Terms and Conditions. The evidence demonstrates that: Your accounts and another trader‚Äôs were repeatedly accessed from the same IP addresses in New Jersey and New York. Your trading activity showed highly synchronized entries, volumes, and durations, indicating coordinated efforts to manipulate the evaluation process. These actions undermine the fairness of our program for all traders, and we have a zero-tolerance policy for such violations. While we understand your frustration, the decision was not made arbitrarily‚Äîit was based on concrete data proving prohibited collaboration. Regarding your concerns about payout processing times and rule changes: Payout delays can occur when additional compliance checks are necessary to prevent fraud and ensure all payouts are legitimate. Rule adjustments are implemented to maintain a balanced and sustainable trading environment, and we always notify traders of updates in advance. It is also worth noting that prior to the breach finding, you successfully received six approved payouts. We stand by our commitment to transparency and fairness. If you have further questions about the evidence, our compliance team remains available for clarification; however, the sanctions imposed are final. We regret that your experience led to this outcome, but we must enforce our policies consistently to protect the integrity of our platform for all traders. Sincerely, TopOne Futures Compliance Team

reviews.title: I still Trade w/TOF, but it's heading the wrong direction
reviews.content: I previously rated them 5 star and now that has changed...You guys have just really been making bad changes and now are at or below the industry standard on a lot of your features.Payouts: On launch you had 2 hour payouts which was industry changing, now your 2 days payouts are slow.You also lowered the payout limits from $5000 to $3500. Now Topstep, apex and take profit all have better payouts than you guys. Your 90/10 split is standard. You've gone from being the new industry standard to being simply avg now. Your one shining point at this time is your customer support. Your customer support times and actual service is AMAZING. The support team is way better than any prop firm in the industry. Sadly, the other areas are now avg at best.  As someone who has support you from the beginning this is really disappointing. You need to rethink your strategy and how you're doing things. You're beginning to be viewed as a cash grab and not really out to help traders. I don't believe that's your intentions, but the optics are what they are.
reviews.reply_content: Hi Trent, Thank you for your honest and thoughtful feedback ‚Äî and for continuing to trade with us since the beginning. We genuinely appreciate your support and perspective. You're right that several changes have been made over time. While some may seem like a step back on the surface, each adjustment was carefully considered to support the long-term health and sustainability of the program. Payout Timing: Our original two-hour payouts were a standout feature, but as we‚Äôve grown, we've had to introduce stricter review layers to handle increased demand and protect against abuse. Despite this, we still aim to process payouts within 24‚Äì48 business hours. $3.5k Payout Cap: This change is part of a structured payout model that helps ensure consistent traders are prioritized for long-term opportunities, rather than rewarding high-risk strategies that aren‚Äôt scalable or sustainable. Customer Support: We‚Äôre glad to hear you‚Äôve had a great experience with our support team. That remains one of the top priorities for us and something we‚Äôll continue to invest in. We understand the optics may not always align with our intentions, but feedback like yours helps us improve. We're actively reviewing internal strategy to make sure we continue moving in the right direction. ‚Äì The Top One Futures Team

reviews.title: predatory firm
reviews.content: initially posted a 5 star after their service begged me for a review but I'd stay far away from this firm now. I did get a payout fast but after the 3rd payout everyone is just getting denied going to live for any of their rules which are purposely generic. Some people are just getting their profits wiped out and given a 50k account and others are just getting straight banned after 3rd payout. Their manager was saying that their staff weren't following a SOP which is also a horrible excuse because it seems to be happening to everyone.I watched first hand other people's messages get deleted off of discord when they posted receipts of their problems. Firm started off promising and then very quickly declined into apex-level territory.Better firms out there. Tradeify/Topstep are miles above these guysedit: to the review they say that they DON'T delete messages, but I quite literally have seen others' messages get deleted in front of my eyes. total nonsense reply trying to save face
reviews.reply_content: We want to clarify that we do not delete any messages from Discord unless they contain violations like spam, harassment, or TOS-breaking behavior. If a trader shares concerns respectfully, we leave the messages untouched. Regarding going live, we only deny transitions if a trader does not meet the live account eligibility criteria. This includes things like risk consistency, proper trade management, and behavior that aligns with our guidelines. If a trader was removed entirely, it would have only occurred after a confirmed rules violation. We understand that some traders may feel frustrated after their third payout, especially if they are placed under review. However, we can confidently say that we transition new traders to live accounts every week. No one is denied arbitrarily, and our SOPs are actively followed and improved based on feedback. If you believe your case was mishandled, feel free to reach out directly. We are always open to reviewing individual cases transparently.

reviews.title: Payout denial.
reviews.content: I requested my first payout 4 days ago and after a day, it is still not being processed. They used to advertise payouts received in couple of hours and now they keep you wait so long.....The support said, "under our new policy",  after the payout is approved, the account will still be paused for the remainder of that day. so 48 hours of pending payouts + 24 hours of pausing = 3 days you cannot use the account once you request a payout. which is very restrictive. it looks like the team design this in a way to delay payouts and trading. Update: They denied my payout on the 46th hour. I had 10600 of profits, and they accumulated all my trades less than 10 seconds (including trades from 10.01 to 10.99 seconds, which is about 1000) and say I have 3700 profits from less than 10s trades. when in fact it is only 2700, 27% of the profit, and they deny it anyway. Eliezer are rude and of little help. He just respond with copy and paste text. and they hang up on you. I open ticket 3 times for this emergency and it always is this rude Eliezer assigned to me. They are becoming sketchy, trying to get money with cheaper prices, but they design the rules to make you fail and deny payouts. Without satisfying solutions, I will share what I experienced on every platform I know to make sure ppl stay away from TOF. After spending 8000USD already on them, I am very upset with the way they treated me. Update: my second payout request is approved according to support. Ash and Alves helped me a lot in this process. Ash even contact the risk team and helped solved some of my concerns. She is an angel.
reviews.reply_content: Hi , Thanks for your feedback. We understand your frustration and truly appreciate the detailed update. To clarify: Our minimum trade duration policy has been clearly outlined in our FAQ since launch. This rule is in place to prevent ultra-high-frequency scalping, and it's enforced consistently across all payout reviews. As stated in the policy: Trades held for 10.00 seconds or less are considered violations. 10.01 seconds or more is compliant. If anywhere close to 50% or more of your total profits, total trades or requested profits are tied to trades that breach this rule, payout eligibility may be impacted. In your case, our internal review calculated that the profits generated from trades held less than 10 seconds exceeded the threshold, which unfortunately triggered a denial. We acknowledge that edge cases close to the limit can feel harsh, and we‚Äôre continuously working to improve both clarity and fairness in our evaluation process. We're also sorry to hear that part of your support experience didn‚Äôt meet expectations ‚Äî we‚Äôll address this internally to ensure better communication moving forward. That said, we‚Äôre glad your second payout request was approved and that Ash and Alves were able to assist you more effectively. If you have additional questions or want to further clarify the calculations, feel free to reach out and we‚Äôd be happy to take another look. ‚Äî The Top One Futures Team

reviews.title: -Resolved- Not what I signed up for...
reviews.content: -Update-After multiple back and forth exchanges, I could not agree with the company proposal and decided to terminate the collaboration after they gave me all the profits left in the account.It was overall a good experienceI started trading with my company since they launched, I had a great experience so far and was able to make multiple withdrawals. After my third payout with one account, I was able to keep trading for 3 profitable days until I couldn't login to projectX anymore, it was just like that without notice. I reached out to their support who informed me I was being reviewed to transition live. After 4 days, I received an email from their COO Todd congratulating me for my performance but states that they will not transition me to live now but needs to see more perfromance (I traded for over 60 days with that account!!!) and they will give me a fresh 100k account with tighter parameters...Anyway, I respectfully declined and answered that this was not I signed up for and they need to honor their agreement , either I go live or they give me back my account so I can resume trading under same conditions.Anyway, I will update the review as soon as I hear back from them
reviews.reply_content: Hi [Trader], Thank you for your detailed review ‚Äî we truly appreciate your long-term participation and the performance you've shown so far. To clarify, your account reached the maximum number of payouts as outlined in our Terms of Service. At that point, per our Path to Live process, your profile was flagged for internal review to determine your eligibility to transition to a live funded account. While your performance was strong, our team determined that we needed to see more consistency under adjusted parameters before finalizing a transition to live capital. This is standard practice to ensure long-term sustainability for both the trader and the firm if we see strong sim trading but are not 100% confident if the same trading would qualify on the live side. We understand this might not have matched your expectations, and we genuinely value your feedback. Our goal is not to take anything away from your success, but rather to guide top performers toward a long-term trading career with us. You are still welcome to continue with the new account we‚Äôve offered ‚Äî or reach back out if you‚Äôd like to revisit the conversation. Thank you again for being part of the community.

reviews.title: Top One Futures = Manipulative Scam ‚Äì Stay Away!
reviews.content: This is the first time in my life I leave a negative review ‚Äî and it‚Äôs because I feel completely scammed by Top One Futures.I bought three $150,000 accounts under conditions that were clearly stated: if I didn‚Äôt qualify for the live program immediately, I would keep my original accounts until I met the requirements.Well, I did exactly that. I followed all the rules, withdrew multiple times, and made over $30,000 in profits. But right when I finished, they pulled the rug out from under me.On the exact same day they emailed me to inform me that my accounts would be taken away, they went into their Help Center and changed the rules, deleting the clause that protected my access to those accounts.This was not a coincidence. It was a premeditated move to steal what I earned, and to avoid paying what they owed me. That‚Äôs not a policy update ‚Äî that‚Äôs fraud.They lie to your face claiming ‚Äútransparency and trust‚Äù on their website, but behind closed doors they change rules, erase evidence, and offer excuses instead of answers. What they‚Äôre doing is classic bait-and-switch: sell one promise, deliver another when it‚Äôs time to pay.I‚Äôm not just another trader. I lead a large Hispanic trading community and already know others who have suffered the same manipulation. I will make sure this message reaches as many people as possible.Top One Futures is NOT a transparent firm ‚Äî they are scammers who hide behind legal wording and fine print to take advantage of traders.Avoid them at all costs. Don‚Äôt learn the hard way like I did.
reviews.reply_content: Hi Daniel, Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We‚Äôre truly sorry to hear that you feel this way and want to address your concerns directly and transparently. We understand you‚Äôve put in significant effort and earned over $30,000 with us, this is no small achievement, and we commend you for it. That said, after reviewing your trading behavior in detail, including a pattern of rule breaches across multiple accounts, our team determined that transitioning to a Live account wasn‚Äôt appropriate at this time. This decision was not taken lightly and followed a thorough internal review based on our stated evaluation criteria. To be clear: no terms were changed retroactively. Our rules and payout policies are published and available to all traders, and we‚Äôve been consistent in applying them across the board. We also notified all traders in advance of any policy updates, including through public channels and in our Help Center. Nothing was ‚Äútaken‚Äù from you as you have withdrawn over $30K USD. In fact, as part of our continued support, we offered‚Äîand still offer‚Äîa free $100K Sim Funded account under our updated structure so you can continue trading while we gather more performance data. We always strive to be fair and transparent, even when our decisions may be difficult or unpopular. If you‚Äôd like to continue the conversation privately, we‚Äôre happy to revisit your file and provide clarity on the decision and next steps. Thank you for being part of the Top One Futures community. Best regards, Todd Hodges COO Top One Futures

reviews.title: This company started out as a force to‚Ä¶
reviews.content: This company started out as a force to be reckoned with in the propfirm space but has quickly backslid into the rearview. Sketchy moves have occurred with rules continuously changing to the detriment of the trader. Now they‚Äôve reduced their sale price from 50% off to 35% off, while scrapping the anytime payout, claiming it‚Äôs a glitch and not sure when it‚Äôs going to be fixed. Customer service has been great, but poor decisions being made at the top; at least for prospective traders. Hopefully this changes, but I wouldn‚Äôt count on it.
reviews.reply_content: Hi there, We appreciate you sharing your experience and understand where your concerns are coming from. To clarify: our 50% discount was part of a Memorial Day promotion, which ‚Äî like any seasonal sale ‚Äî was always meant to be temporary. We regularly adjust our promotions based on timing, campaign goals, and product lineup, just like any company would. The current 35% offer reflects competitive pricing after the promotional period. Regarding the Anytime Payout Add-On, we temporarily removed it after identifying a visual bug that made it appear as though it was automatically included on accounts, even when it wasn‚Äôt purchased. This understandably led to confusion, when it was not actually included and we didn‚Äôt want traders unknowingly expecting a feature which they didn't really activate. We are actively working on restoring it in a clearer, more reliable way. Once this has been fixed it will be back online. reviews.title: changed my review
reviews.content: Guys, by the Terms&Cond. you cannot email too often (nobody knows how much). So, I was not blocked but after two weeks stopped to email TOF, as they just did not answer anyway to my requests why my balance was reset below the Max. loss limit. I had 6% qualified payout but they paid out 30%  (NET) only whilst removed from the balance whole 6% leaving me in negative breach. After I challenged them, they agreed to approve extra 19% but still did not update my balance. Also, look out what they say about their platform's algorithm and your orders. I have never experienced unusual UP's & DOWN's on any other platforms. Your SL will be wiped out. I found the way to use that U&D so my account was active but I was left without any chance to trade further because of the balance was below the MLL. I am also using 2 and found 1 more much better platforms. No regrets apart from wasted time and all their fees like 'activation' & ext Compare to Funding Pips (I do not use them, just used figures from propfirmmatch_com/payouts=ALL time), which paid over $130M their payouts are nothing. The LAST but not the LEAST - after my reduced 30% (NET) I received an email from them (assume it was templated) telling that they offer me $100 ETHICAL BRIBE!!!!! for recording a short video about my Payout. I offered them $100 :)) if they will explain to me why I was paid only 30% but the total 6% qualified for the payout amount was deducted leaving my balance negative.

reviews.title: Elite Challenge Passed, 3 Payouts Earned ‚Äî Still Denied Live Due to Vague ‚ÄúAccount Churning‚Äù Policy
reviews.content: Updated Review:I joined TopOne Futures through their Elite Challenge Program, not their instant Sim Funded account. I followed the rules, completed the challenges legitimately, and earned three successful payouts, which‚Äîper their program terms‚Äîshould qualify a trader to transition to a Live Account.Instead, I was denied access and had all my funded accounts closed(3 accounts with $30k profits each). The reason given was a supposed violation of their ‚ÄúAccount Churning‚Äù policy. They claimed I purchased 90 accounts within 10 days, but in reality, I only had 59 total accounts, and I used copy trading on 3 accounts at a time as a single strategy‚Äînot to manipulate, but to stay consistent.Worse, their churning rule is vague and based entirely on internal interpretation. Here's the excerpt from their Terms:    ‚ÄúCreating multiple evaluation accounts in a short period and using a batch-style approach‚Äîintentionally letting most accounts fail while focusing on passing just one‚Äîis strictly prohibited. Excessive account creation, especially when repeated, is considered manipulative and will be flagged by our systems.‚ÄùThis rule doesn't define what "excessive" means, nor does it clarify intent. If anything, it leaves the door open for them to retroactively penalize traders‚Äîeven those who succeeded through legitimate effort.To be clear: I received no payouts from the earlier accounts they‚Äôre using against me‚Äîonly the final 3, which were all profitable and rule-compliant. I passed all phases of their Elite Challenge fairly. Yet I was still denied a Live Account.Also worth noting:    Payout speed has slowed to 1‚Äì2 business days‚Äîslower than before.    Rules are being changed retroactively, often with no clear communication.    Unless you pass and maintain a single funded account flawlessly, your chances of going Live are low‚Äîeven if you earn 3 payouts.If account churning is such a critical issue, TopOne Futures should do what other firms do‚Äîlimit how many accounts/resets a trader can purchase. Instead, they allow unlimited purchases (which they profit from), then use a vague policy to invalidate success after the fact.I put in real effort, time, and discipline. I followed the rules, completed their toughest challenge, and succeeded‚Äîonly to be disqualified based on a loosely defined interpretation of a policy that doesn‚Äôt directly reflect my trading behavior.It‚Äôs a deeply disappointing and unfair experience, and I hope others think twice before committing time and money here.
reviews.reply_content: Thank you for sharing your experience! We‚Äôre glad to hear our support team and payout speed exceeded your expectations. Your understanding of our rule adjustments and focus on long-term sustainability is truly appreciated. We‚Äôre committed to supporting consistent traders like you every step of the way!

Our goal isn‚Äôt to "churn and burn" accounts ‚Äî it‚Äôs to reward consistent, risk-conscious traders who are building sustainable habits and aiming for long-term success. We've adjusted some of our rules to better align with this mission and to ensure that traders reaching the live-funded stage are genuinely prepared. We‚Äôre not looking for sim farmers who aim to game the system for short-term wins. We want to work with real traders, and that‚Äôs why we‚Äôve created different account types ‚Äî some with stricter consistency models, and others more flexible ‚Äî so everyone can choose what fits their strategy. Thanks again for your feedback.

reviews.title: BE CAUTIOUS
reviews.content: To be honest, these guys are built on stilts and its quite hard to trust them. I have had many accounts with them, was able to get two $5k payouts quite easily at the beginning. Then rumours started they were struggling, my next $4k payout, I only recevied $1800 of it, they took the the balance saying I wasn't holding trades long enough. Now I have 3 $150k accounts, and they have changed the rules, it used to be 2% profit, now it needs to be 5%. It used to be $5k payouts, now it is $3500. they promised a lot and then took it all back. Will be moving back to Tradeify because at least with them, you can increase your payouts. These guys don't care and are rejecting payouts for any reason now. Just thought I was going to be able to submit a payout and now i heard about this 5% profit increase from 2%. I have a balance of $6k each on my account, and can only withdraw $3500..but they are changing the rules and I would not be surprised to see these guys go under.
reviews.reply_content: Thanks for your feedback, Kirat. We want to clarify that payouts are only adjusted or reduced when rules are violated ‚Äî such as closing trades too quickly and breaching the 10 second minimum hold time rule. This is clearly outlined in our FAQ and in the trader agreement signed before account activation. Regarding payout targets and structure: these apply only to newly purchased accounts and not to existing ones, so any change you‚Äôre referring to would not retroactively affect your current accounts. Thank you, Lars

reviews.title: Major Platform Bug on Project X Cost Me Entire Account ‚Äì Prop Firm Refuses Accountability
reviews.content: I was actually having a good experience with this prop firm until Thursday. I was trading MGC (Micro Gold Contract) throughout the night ‚Äî this is fully verifiable and visible in my order log and trade history.I placed a limit order for 10 contracts at my desired level. Once it was filled, the price dropped significantly and very quickly ‚Äî a normal occurrence for gold. When I attempted to close the position, I suddenly saw I was down nearly -$4,000. I looked again and realized the trade was on GC (full-size Gold Contract) ‚Äî not MGC.I never traded GC that night. There were zero drawings or indicators on its chart, whereas my MGC chart was fully active. My account had a balance of around $153.5k, which I had been slowly building. It was wiped out in under a minute.I contacted support, and a day later they told me it happened because I ‚Äúdidn't use the link feature.‚Äù But this is not true. I was absolutely using the link feature ‚Äî I‚Äôve used Project X with other prop firms and I‚Äôm very familiar with it. I never refreshed, moved away, or switched to GC. There was simply no reason to ‚Äî and no chart activity or evidence that I ever interacted with GC.Anyone who trades gold knows that opening 10 GC contracts with that kind of balance is reckless and obviously unintended.I asked them again to review the situation, and once again they gave the same explanation ‚Äî that I didn‚Äôt use the link feature. But the facts are clear: I was trading MGC all night, right up to the minute before this incident. There is simply 0% chance that I switched to GC since I did not switch charts or order book, refresh or open a new tab. Even if there was a hidden refresh on browser, the link should not break, if I am using the link it means it should be good until I break it. It is like this on every other projectx platform. This isn‚Äôt even my first issue with their Project X platform. On my first day using this firm, copy trading randomly stopped working for one of my trades. It didn't copy a single order ‚Äî the order log was completely empty. The day before, it was working fine. Another follower account was also working normally at the same time. They acknowledged this bug and gave me a credit for it.This current issue feels like another system failure ‚Äî but because this time I had a much larger account and the outcome was worse, they seem unwilling to take responsibility. Instead, they blame the user for something that clearly did not happen.Mistakes happen, but denying platform faults and deflecting blame onto users is a serious red flag for any prop firm.Edit: Just a few words regarding Lars responses. 1- I never received a single screenshot from Top One Futures support in my support chat. This is a clear case of misinformation.2- I am 100% certain that I had enabled the link and traded with it all night. Even if the link broke due to a browser auto-refresh, that would indicate a system failure‚Äîbecause on other Project X platforms, the link does not break when the page is refreshed. If it did, every trader would be forced to re-establish the link after each browser refresh or when opening a new tab, which clearly isn‚Äôt the intended behavior.
reviews.reply_content: Hi 'Rez', Thank you for your detailed review. We understand how frustrating it is to experience such a loss, and we‚Äôve taken the time to thoroughly investigate your case. To clarify: our system logs confirm that the order for the GC contract was manually submitted from your account. The order was not placed by our platform or due to any background automation. Additionally, the chart link feature (which ensures you‚Äôre trading the correct symbol across tabs) was not active at the time of the order. This is not a bug ‚Äî it‚Äôs standard behavior when the link is disabled or lost due to browser refreshes or inactivity. While we sympathize with the result, we can only assess these cases based on data from our backend and Project X's order logs. Our support team has provided this information to you, along with the relevant screenshots. As for your previous platform issue, we did acknowledge the error and issued a gesture of goodwill to ensure fairness ‚Äî and we would do the same in the case of verifiable platform malfunctions. We understand that this outcome is disappointing, but in this case, the trade was executed as placed, and the position size matched the order that came from your account directly. We remain committed to supporting traders and maintaining transparency in our processes. Lars

reviews.title: Demoralized on a Monday
reviews.content: I had wrote a 5 star review prior because when it took them almost 2 days to get my activation done due to an issue with their payment portal they waived the activation fee. But yesterday the legacy accounts were shut down and I got an email saying my accounts were breached and it was a bit of a shock at first but they gave new accounts with a 0 balance which was good but it meant my lockout for the day was no more so I proceeded to trade the NY session and put my account in big DD. The reason I use topone is specifically for the features to lock myself out after I trade the Asia session and I had done this for the day. I reached out to support and explained my situation that it caught me off guard and I was having a very bad day and got bad news and I asked nicely if I could get the balance reset because if this didn't happen I would have been locked out until Asia today and not had any temptation to trade. They refused to do this even when I explained it's the most consistent I have ever been on my funded accounts since starting trading. Just very demoralizing to have made such progress and for this to happen and knock me back and I'm not in a financial position at present to get more funding and was really minding these accounts.Traded my usual this morning and accounts now gone carried this annoyance into today.I had my accounts almost 3 weeks had just pulled myself out of drawdown for the second time now this lolI know I'm the one who placed the trades and I need to be accountable for that but at the same time I have been working very hard to keep on top of my disipline and locking myself out after every session like clockwork and was making bid strides in my trading and the response I got from customer support is "we reset your account it was your responsibility to not trade it" which I agree with but also what is it for them to just reset my account if they say they want traders to succeed. We all know how hard it is to succeed as a trader and for a company to be making god knows how much a week and not show compassion in a situation like this is a bit crazy in my eyes.I really like the platform and features and here's hoping they can make things right as I'd like to have max allocation of accounts with topone and was planning on adding one more account to have max allocation.
reviews.reply_content: Thanks for taking the time to share this, and we genuinely appreciate the kind words about the platform and your previous experience with our support. To clarify: when the legacy accounts were discontinued, we offered every affected trader the choice between a refund or a full reset to the starting balance on a new structure. You chose the reset ‚Äî and we were happy to give you that fresh start. However, once the reset is issued, the account becomes fully active, and it's the trader‚Äôs responsibility to manage it from that point forward ‚Äî whether that means waiting to trade, setting new lockout parameters, or simply stepping back for the day. We completely understand how frustrating it can feel to lose progress, especially when you‚Äôve been working hard on discipline and routine. But our role is to ensure a fair and equal process for every trader, and we do have to maintain consistency in how we apply account resets and breaches. That said, we're still rooting for your success and are here to support you however we can. If you ever want help choosing the right structure or setting up your lockouts again, feel free to reach out anytime.

reviews.title: consistency rule should be removed!
reviews.content: I am rating with one star only for one reason... I find the consistency rule to be not logical at all. It's only purpose is to cap profit by limiting a single day's profit to a max of 20% of total profit. I cannot see the logic behind it. The purpose of using a prop firm is to benefit from the capital they offer to make profit. Period. I totally understand the drawdown rules since capital is not free and should be protected but capping single day profit is totally not understandable and can be considered as a way to limit withdrawals for a reason I don't understand. It is a shame for a company with such a great support team to implement such a rule....
reviews.reply_content: Thanks for sharing your feedback, Joumana ‚Äî we appreciate your honesty. We understand that the consistency rule may not align with all trading strategies, especially those with larger single-day gains. The aim of this rule isn‚Äôt to cap traders unfairly, but to encourage long-term, sustainable trading habits. It helps protect both the trader and the firm from excessive risk-taking that might not be repeatable over time. That said, in the futures world a consistency rule is a very common rule, it incentives consistent profits rather than a one time 'lucky' trade. We‚Äôre always looking to improve and truly value your feedback. If you have any further thoughts or would like help choosing the right plan for your style, we‚Äôre here for you anytime.

We clearly note this in our official documentation: '‚ö†Ô∏è Important Disclaimer: The DLL should never be relied upon to close your trades at a precise level. Due to volatility, news events, slippage, and execution delays, the DLL may trigger earlier, later, or at a different price than expected. If you want to limit your risk with precision, we always recommend using a hard stop loss on your trades.' We understand your concern, but this is not a platform malfunction or a ‚Äúscam‚Äù ‚Äî it‚Äôs a known and expected aspect of market mechanics, and it's every trader‚Äôs responsibility to manage this accordingly.

If you're experiencing issues specific to your account, we'd appreciate the chance to investigate it further‚Äîplease reach out to us with the details so we can review everything thoroughly. Regarding your concern about reviews‚Äîour team may encourage satisfied users to leave honest feedback after a positive support interaction, but we do not force or script reviews. Every trader is welcome to share their true experience, positive or negative. As for the 20% consistency rule, it's clearly outlined in our FAQs before purchase and is designed to support long-term, stable trading practices. That said, we understand it might not suit every strategy‚Äîand that‚Äôs okay. We offer a variety of account types, some with a lower consistency requirements, to better match different styles of trading. We‚Äôre here to answer any further questions you may have. reviews.title: Hidden and unfair rules
reviews.content: Got a 25k Sim to funded, had a bad day and hit the Daily loss limit. next day i recover from the loss, and make some profit. then im told i have to make over 5000 dollars in order to be able to withdraw anything, since im over the consistency...so a 20 percent gain on the balance of the account before i can take anything since the account size is 25000!. firm has many nosense and hidden rules like that,moreover they are changing the clear rules too since people are getting to withdraw. the firm isnt working for your sake, is working just to get you to buy more accounts and pocket your cash! use others firms, dont waste your money, this smells like the next fast track trading.
reviews.reply_content: Hi Rubiel, Thanks for sharing your feedback. I had a look at your case and wanted to clarify a few things: We don‚Äôt have any hidden rules. The consistency rule is fully explained in our FAQ and payout page, and applies to all traders equally. It‚Äôs designed to encourage sustainable trading habits rather than high-risk, one-off spikes. In your case, the 20% consistency threshold was triggered after a large portion of your profit came from a single day. That doesn‚Äôt disqualify you from a payout ‚Äî it just means you‚Äôll need to build more consistent performance over time before the first withdrawal can be processed. We also haven‚Äôt changed any rules on the fly ‚Äî all updates are documented and shared transparently with our community. I completely understand that hitting a rule you weren‚Äôt expecting can be frustrating, and we‚Äôre always open to improving clarity. If anything ever seems unclear, our 24/7 team is always here to explain. If you‚Äôd like to go over your stats together or talk next steps, feel free to reach out via support or email.

reviews.title: Quickly going downhill
reviews.content: Edited 5/23/2025:I‚Äôm rapidly losing confidence in Top One Futures. The number and pace of rule changes have been concerning.Back on April 27th, the company introduced significant updates‚Äîparticularly to the 150K accounts‚Äîand clearly stated these would apply only to new accounts. At the time, I wasn‚Äôt too worried since I didn‚Äôt plan on buying any more.Then came May 9th, and without warning, those same rules were retroactively applied to all accounts, regardless of when they were purchased. That felt like a bait-and-switch. Still, I tried to stay positive and continued forward.Fast forward to May 22nd, and once again‚Äîmore major rule changes. We were told (again) that they were only for new accounts. But after the last rollback, I have zero confidence that this won‚Äôt eventually be made retroactive as well.Leadership continues to frame these decisions as necessary for long-term sustainability, but it‚Äôs hard to ignore that traders are the ones absorbing the impact. Especially when there are now other straight-to-funded firms offering much more favorable terms.I was an early supporter‚Äîbought my account the very first day they were available. Now I‚Äôm genuinely starting to regret not waiting longer to see how things played out. Every firm experiences growing pains. But transparency and consistency are critical, especially when traders are putting their capital and trust on the line. Right now, Top One Futures feels like it‚Äôs moving in the wrong direction.If you're considering joining, I‚Äôd recommend waiting to see how these changes shake out before committing.ORIGINAL REVIEW:  I‚Äôve been with Top One Futures for a little while now, and although I‚Äôve experienced a few dashboard hiccups‚Äîlike incorrect MLL tracking and a trade that initially showed as a loss when it was actually a win‚Äîthe support team has been nothing short of exceptional.Early on, I discovered my account had been incorrectly coded with a trailing drawdown instead of EOD. Zach stepped in, acknowledged the mistake, and promptly issued me a new account‚Äîno questions, just solutions.Today, I noticed another issue where a winning trade was being incorrectly reflected as a loss. Ash jumped on it right away and got it resolved within the hour, and Alves personally followed up to make sure everything was good on my end.Every firm has growing pains, especially newer ones, but what sets Top One apart is how they handle those bumps in the road. Their transparency, responsiveness, and genuine care for traders have made me a loyal supporter.If you're looking for a firm that stands behind their traders and resolves issues quickly and respectfully‚ÄîTop One Futures is the real deal.
reviews.reply_content: Thank you so much for sharing your experience in such detail. We truly appreciate your patience and understanding as we've worked through a few early-stage challenges. It‚Äôs great to hear that Zach, Ash, and Alves were each able to step in quickly and effectively to ensure your concerns were addressed with care and transparency. At Top One Futures, we understand that growing with our traders means being accountable, responsive, and committed to continuous improvement. Your trust and support mean the world to us, and we‚Äôre honored to have you as part of the community. We‚Äôre here for you every step of the way‚Äîthank you for choosing Top One Futures!
